p: Ijarotimi et al. ( 2013) evaluated the effect of germination and fermentation on the functional properties of M. oleifera flour. The apparent mass density 0.45 g/ml (measured without packing) and the true mass density of M. oleifera seeds (0.63 g/ml) did not vary significantly with seed fermentation and germination (Ijarotimi et al., 2013). As some leguminous seeds (bambara groundnut: 0.60–0.75 g/ml), the flour of M. oleifera seeds has a low mass density (Onimawo & Egbekun, 1998).
